channel.title: Krishna
channel.description: Not tutorials. Not motivation. Just real experiments, technical notes, and things I built while figuring stuff out.

item.title: April 2025 ‚Äì The Month I Fix Everything
item.description: A monthly reminder to get back on track‚Äîfix my schedule, focus on IELTS, and stop wasting time. No distractions, no delays. Just discipline.

item.title: She Just Messaged Me‚Ä¶ Now What?
item.description: She finally messaged me! After all this time, out of nowhere‚ÄîHlo. Just three letters, but now my brain is spinning in circles. Does she wanna talk? Should I call? Or is it just a random check-in? I don‚Äôt know what to do, so here I am, overthinking like always‚Ä¶

item.title: Noise Bleed Dream
item.description: The rain, the memories, the scent of wet earth‚Äîeverything pulls me back to that one moment, that one girl. A dream so real it feels like a lost reality. And when I wake up, the silence bleeds just like the noise once did.

item.title: She Was Here, But Not for Me
item.description: She came to my city. She smiled, celebrated, and danced. I found out through stories, tags, and friends. But never from her. I didn‚Äôt matter. That hurt more than I thought it would.

item.title: She Messaged‚Ä¶ Then Ignored üòû
item.description: Bro, I thought something was wrong. I skipped college, waited all day, worried like crazy‚Ä¶ and she? She was just chilling with her friends. Why did she even text me? Why does she keep doing this?

item.title: My April Plan - Bulking, Studying, and Staying Disciplined
item.description: A monthly reminder to get back on track‚Äîfix my schedule, focus on IELTS, and stop wasting time. No distractions, no delays. Just discipline.

item.title: First Year - First Semester Gone üò∂
item.description: Just like that, my first semester is over. Went to college, bunked classes, played games, and somehow ended up writing exams. Made zero new friends, avoided all drama, and now I‚Äôm just sitting here wondering‚Äîdid I even do anything useful? ü§°

item.title: Enchanted ‚Äì I Was Terrified
item.description: Is she waiting For someone.....

item.title: Locked Away ‚Äì My Reply
item.description: You sent me a snap with that song‚ÄîLocked Away. For a second, I thought it meant something. I listened, I felt it, I overthought it. But in the end, was it even for me?

item.title: Songs, Memories, and the Shit I Can‚Äôt Escape
item.description: She‚Äôs just a call away. But I can‚Äôt call her. And I don‚Äôt even know why.

item.title: The Real One?
item.description: new account - ‚Äúher__she__yy_‚Äù.üòá

item.title: Those Eyes ‚Äì New West
item.description: The song is just good to Dream.i was just Feeling the Song For An Hour.

item.title: Finding Her Location - 16 June 2023
item.description: She‚Äôs out there, smiling, living a life where I no longer exist. But I‚Äôm still here, tracing shadows of our past, searching for pieces of her in a world that moved on without me.

item.title: The One Issue I Must Resolve
item.description: My heart races at 100 BPM, a silent battle no one notices. High metabolism, stress, restless sleep‚Äîit all connects. I must regain control, for my mind and body.

item.title: Why Is This So Long?!
item.description: A long journey of over-explaining everything with no end in sight.

item.title: Never Mind - The Version in My Dreams
item.description: I just want to stay there, in my dreams, with my 10-year-old Harshi. Not this version of her‚Äîthe one who has forgotten me. No. The one I created in my mind, in my memories, in my dreams. The one that never left. The one that still looks at me like I matter.

item.title: Left on Request
item.description: Kept checking if she accepted the request, if she saw the message‚Äîshe didn‚Äôt. Just watched the request and moved on. Like a curry leaf in curry‚Ä¶ used, then tossed aside.

item.title: Where Was She All Day? ü§î
item.description: After waiting so long, I saw her snaps and realized she‚Äôs just super busy. I know her‚Äîshe probably saw my messages but got caught up. üòä

item.title: ‚ÄúMaybe Everyone Is Right‚Ä¶ Or Maybe Not‚Äù
item.description: Dont ever open this

item.title: APS Application Submission
item.description: I made my APS account, paid ‚Çπ18,000, and sent my documents to Delhi with Nitheesh‚Äôs help. Now, I wait 60 days and start IELTS prep again‚Äîno turning back!

item.title: Mom‚Äôs Predictions vs. My Decision
item.description: Mom tried to stop me from going to SRM, saying she knew exactly what would happen. And honestly? She wasn‚Äôt wrong. But still, I have to go. Not for studies, not for career‚Äîjust to see her. Whatever it takes.

item.title: One Missed Ring, One Realization
item.description: One unexpected ring, a moment of false hope, and a flood of realizations‚Äîsome stories don‚Äôt need a villain, just enough silence.

item.title: The Day I Fought Git, Netlify, and My Own Sanity ‚Äì And Lost
item.description: I spent an entire day trying to make my blog private using Git submodules, SSH keys, and Netlify deploys‚Äîonly to end up right where I started. A story of failed automation, endless debugging, and a lesson in why overcomplicating things is a terrible idea.

item.title: I LOVE INDIA ‚Äì THE LOST NOTE (05 JAN 2021)
item.description: A forgotten note, a childhood memory, and a single mistake‚Äîwhat happens when the only piece of the past you held onto suddenly disappears?

item.title: Just a Random Follow? Or Something Else?
item.description: So today, Vishnu ‚Äî yeah, the same Vishnu a.k.a. son of PVR ‚Äî followed me.

item.title: Starboy & Stargirl ‚Äì A Universe Meant to Collide
item.description: I am Starboy. And she is my Stargirl.

item.title: I Just Controlled Myself the Whole Day, Telling Myself Not to Call Her‚Ä¶
item.description: tried my best not to call her, not to think about her. But no matter what I do, she‚Äôs still in my mind. She never calls, never checks in‚Äîbut what if, one day, she does? Would that change anything?

item.title: It's My 20th Birthday - Without Notifications
item.description: changing my birthday just to see who actually remembers without a notification. No social media reminders, no posts, just pure memory. And the results? Exactly what I expected.

item.title: A Turning Point - My Experience with College Admissions
item.description: A personal journey through the ups and downs of my college admission process decisions, doubts, and the final choice that shaped my path.

item.title: CS50 Cybersecurity 2024
item.description: Signed up for CS50 Cybersecurity out of curiosity, took four months instead of eight weeks, and got the certificate. Was it useful? Maybe. Was it needed? Probably not. Just something to look back on.

item.title: Sometimes I Think I Can Dream in 4K
item.description: A broken leg, a classroom full of eyes, and then her. Harshi. Not a blur, not a dream‚Äîjust real. And her gesture, telling me to calm down‚Ä¶ That moment, that look‚ÄîI can never forget.

item.title: Planned What to Do‚ÄîBoth Ways
item.description: If she calls, I‚Äôll stick to her word. If she doesn‚Äôt, I need to move forward. This time, no waiting, no second thoughts‚Äîjust a plan for both outcomes.

item.title: The Dream
item.description: The Dream That Keeps Coming Back

item.title: Stuck Between a Dream and Reality
item.description: She called. She wanted to meet. It felt real‚Äîtoo real. But then, just like that, everything flickered, and I realized‚Ä¶ I wasn‚Äôt awake. And when I finally did wake up, all that was left was silence, an empty phone, and the weight of a dream that felt too much like reality.

item.title: First Time Away
item.description: Staying away from home for the first time felt like hell. Three days without my parents, without my usual routine, and my mind just wouldn‚Äôt shut up. And then, just like that, a childhood memory hit me out of nowhere‚Äîreminding me of the time I asked her to hug me. The past and present blurred, dreams felt more real than reality, and for a moment, I forgot where I even was.

item.title: See How Stupid I Am
item.description: See how stupid I am‚Äîoverthinking for a whole day, and all she sent was a ‚ÄúHi.‚Äù

item.title: Lost Between Dreams and Reality again
item.description: yet in my dreams, she responds as if nothing has changed. Each night, my mind provides the closure I long for, only for reality to remind me of the silence. A cycle of hope and disappointment, where dreams offer comfort that reality refuses to give.

item.title: End of 2024 ‚Äì My Feelings Now About Her
item.description: A year has passed, and I thought I had everything under control‚Äîmy routine, my focus, my plans. But just one call from her, and everything changed. My schedule is gone, my mind is stuck in the past, and I‚Äôm trapped in a loop of waiting. This is me, trying to figure out what I actually need.

item.title: My Blog Tutorial
item.description: In this blog post, I‚Äôll walk you through the process of creating a blog website using Astro, which I‚Äôve affectionately named "magical-metal." Whether you‚Äôre new to Astro or just looking for inspiration for your next project, I hope this guide helps you get started with this powerful static site generator.

item.title: Waiting for My Birthday Again‚Ä¶
item.description: Just like last year, I‚Äôm playing the same little game‚Äîchanging my birthday, turning off social media, and waiting. Will she remember? Or was it always just a reminder notification? This time, I‚Äôll find out.

item.title: From Text Docs to GitHub‚ÄîMy Secret Archive
item.description: At first, I just typed everything into random text files‚Äîthoughts, memories, things I never wanted to forget. But then, I found the perfect place to store them all‚ÄîGitHub. Now, it‚Äôs like my own little time machine, hidden in plain sight. And the best part? My mom will never find it.

item.title: Finally, I Got It‚Ä¶ She‚Äôs Not Coming Back
item.description: I waited, I hoped, I tried‚Ä¶ but she didn‚Äôt care. No more calls, no more messages, no more waiting. It‚Äôs time to move on, even if it hurts.

item.title: Hey Future Me, I Fixed My Old Blogs with AI!
item.description: I found out that ChatGPT 3.5 can fix my messy writing without changing how I feel! So, I used it to update all my old blogs and make them perfectly me. But there was a limit‚Ä¶ so I kinda cheated (just a little!). Read my adventure of turning my raw thoughts into something even better! üöÄüòÜ

item.title: She Called Me - A Sudden Shock
item.description: A sudden call from her after so long‚Äîmy heart raced. Was it about us? Or something else entirely? What she said left me speechless.

item.title: The Idol - The Weeknd's Ego Project
item.description: The Weeknd‚Äôs ‚Äúmasterpiece‚Äù ‚Äì a cinematic experience so profound that I regret every second of my life spent watching it. Abel, we love you, but please, never ever attempt this again. Stick to making good music, bro. That‚Äôs where the magic is! üò≠üé∂

item.title: Why I Started Krypto Hashers Community (KHC)
item.description: Krypto Hashers Community (KHC) was born out of the struggle of building alone. After years of jumping into projects with little knowledge, facing bugs without guidance, and abandoning many ideas halfway, I realized there had to be a better way. KHC is a space for developers who are learning, stuck, or just trying to grow. It‚Äôs not about perfection, it‚Äôs about building, breaking, fixing, and building again ‚Äî together. Whether you‚Äôre stuck on a bug or want to collaborate, you‚Äôre welcome here. KHC forever üïäÔ∏è

item.title: My First Crypto Mining Attempt on a MacBook Air M1 ‚Äì A Wild Ride into Blockchain
item.description: Back in 2021, I got curious about Bitcoin mining and decided to give it a shot on my MacBook Air M1‚Äîspoiler alert, it didn‚Äôt go as planned. From learning about blockchain, Proof of Work, and mining pools to facing MacOS restrictions and hardware limitations, this experiment turned into a crash course in crypto. While I didn‚Äôt strike gold, I walked away with valuable insights into the world of Bitcoin mining. Curious to know what went down? Check it out!

item.title: My Journey into Monero Mining - A Harsh Reality Check
item.description: After struggling to mine Bitcoin on my MacBook Air M1, I stumbled upon Monero (XMR)‚Äîa CPU-friendly cryptocurrency using the RandomX algorithm. Excited to give mining another shot, I set up my wallet, installed XMRig, and joined a mining pool. But what started as an experiment quickly turned into a battle against overheating, high CPU usage, and painfully low rewards. After hours of mining, I earned just a few cents‚Äîbarely enough to cover my laptop‚Äôs electricity cost. This adventure proved that mining on a regular laptop isn‚Äôt worth it, but the experience? A priceless lesson in crypto mining.

item.title: Mining Dreams, Government Screams - The Great Indian Krypto Struggle
item.description: ‚ÄúBro, in India, if you want to start something innovative, first you need to mine through government rules before mining crypto. By the time you figure out the legal stuff, either the law changes, or some babu finds a new way to tax you. It‚Äôs like playing a game where the rules keep updating, but your character is still stuck at level 1.‚Äù

item.title: Mining Monero on GitHub Codespaces - My Experiment and Lessons Learned
item.description: I had a wild idea‚Äîwhat if I mined Monero using free cloud services like GitHub Codespaces? After days of tweaking, bypassing restrictions, and even roping in old accounts, I managed to get it running. But reality hit hard. Between auto-shutdowns, account suspensions, and minimal earnings, the whole experiment turned out to be a massive waste of time. Lesson learned, just because something is ‚Äúfree‚Äù doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs worth the effort.

item.title: Realization Loop
item.description: struggling with reality, love, and the demons of the past.

item.title: Lost in a World That Isn‚Äôt Real
item.description: Dreams are killing me. No matter how much I try to escape, they keep pulling me back‚Äîshowing me things that will never happen, making me relive memories that shouldn‚Äôt hurt anymore. I don‚Äôt know how to stop it, but I need to. Before I lose myself completely.

item.title: She Just Proved Me Wrong Again
item.description: Just like last year, I‚Äôm playing the same little game‚Äîchanging my birthday, turning off social media, and waiting. Will she remember? Or was it always just a reminder notification? This time, I‚Äôll find out.

item.title: From Gains to Babysitting - How I Became Everyone‚Äôs Personal Trainer!
item.description: A two-month journey of strength training turned into a frustrating time sink due to unwanted distractions. From gym bros overstaying their welcome to wasted hours, I realized the importance of setting boundaries. Now, it‚Äôs time to reset‚Äînew plan, new mindset, no more wasted time.

item.title: The Most Annoying Experience Ever!
item.description: Ever had one of those moments where someone‚Äôs actions make zero sense? Yeah, this is one of those days. From random calls to ridiculous requests, to someone thinking they‚Äôre the boss of me‚Äîthis experience was just ugh! Here‚Äôs why staying home is sometimes the best choice‚Ä¶

item.title: They Banned Me?! But I Didn‚Äôt Do Anything!
item.description: Got an email saying my TOEFL scores were canceled because they think I cheated‚Äîwhat?! Now I‚Äôm banned for a year! Called Dhamodhar, he said don‚Äôt worry

item.title: Loser Me ‚Äì A Note to My Future Self
item.description: Happy 30th, man. So, what‚Äôs up? You really made it, or you still stuck in the same old mess? Did you get everything we planned, or did life humble you again? You reading this to smile, or to regret? Whatever it is‚Äîyou already know.

item.title: Overthinking is just killing me.
item.description: A sudden call from her after so long‚Äîmy heart raced. Was it about us? Or something else entirely? What she said left me speechless.

item.title: Russian Language Cybercriminal Forums ‚Äì The Amazon Prime of Illegal Stuff
item.description: Russian hackers really out here running cybercrime like a startup‚Äîcredit card fraud with tech support, ransomware on a subscription plan, and even customer service for stolen data.

item.title: The Internship Scam - 1stop
item.description: A friend asked me to join an internship as a favor, but I quickly realized it was a scam. Despite my warnings, he insisted, so I played along to see how it worked. In the end, he did it all for someone else, only to be used and discarded.‚Äînever fall for such traps again.

item.title: Waiting Like a Kid Again
item.description: I don‚Äôt know why I keep doing this. Sent her a message, waiting for a reply, overthinking every small thing like an idiot. Maybe she cares, maybe she doesn‚Äôt‚Äîlet‚Äôs see how this goes.

item.title: Marriage Is Not for Me Without Her
item.description: Marriage‚Äîthe so-called "ultimate goal" society pushes on everyone. But is it really for you? Or is it just a lifelong trap disguised as a dream?

item.title: End of 2022 ‚Äì A Year of Waiting
item.description: My thoughts after a year of waiting‚Äîendless calls, unanswered moments, and realizations that hit harder than expected. A look back at everything I felt, hoped for, and finally understood.

item.title: A Year‚Äôs End, A Sentimental Crisis, and an iPod Fix
item.description: A nostalgic year-end cleanup turned into a high-stakes mission to revive my 16-year-old iPod. After days of struggle, I finally brought it back to life‚Äîonly to realize I had accidentally erased all my cherished photos, including the one that stopped my heart. A solid bad start to the year.

item.title: End of 2023 ‚Äì Lost in the Loop, Numbed by the Game
item.description: Tried hard to control everything this year, but one mistake pulled me back. She ignored, laughed it off, and now I‚Äôm just another joke. Gaming numbs the thoughts for a while, but the loop never really ends.

item.title: Year-End - First Year of College Complete
item.description: my first year of college‚Äîmoving from Tirupati to Srikalahasti, daily routines, new friendships, and the struggles of staying in a place filled with old memories.

item.title: My Pytorch Learning Process
item.description: Welcome to my journey of learning PyTorch! This Blog documents my progress, insights, and projects as I delve into the world of deep learning using PyTorch.

item.title: Building an Image-to-Text Converter with Handwritten Text Recognition
item.description: This project is a Flask-based web application that allows users to upload images containing text, which is then converted into digital text. The real challenge lies in enabling the app to accurately recognize handwritten text. To achieve this, I trained a custom model using PyTorch, focusing on a Convolutional Recurrent Neural Network (CRNN) architecture to handle the complexity of handwritten characters.

item.title: Understanding Ransomware and a Dive into Snakes Ransomware
item.description: Snakes Ransomware is a Python-based tool I‚Äôve developed to demonstrate the encryption and decryption processes involved in ransomware. While this project is intended purely for educational purposes, it highlights the mechanics of ransomware in a controlled environment.

item.title: The Best Gift She Never Knew She Gave Me
item.description: She gave me the best gift without even knowing it‚Äîshe made the impossible happen. Just for a moment, just in a dream, she placed me right beside her. But reality‚Ä¶

item.title: I Called‚Ä¶ But No One Answered!
item.description: Yesterday, I got terminated from my TOEFL exam, and it left me questioning everything‚Äîshould I really go for my master‚Äôs? Or is something telling me to stay back? I decided to call Harshi, hoping for clarity. But what happens when the one person you seek answers from doesn‚Äôt even pick up?

item.title: Again, My Pulse Just Raising Up
item.description: She‚Äôs just a call away. But I can‚Äôt call her. And I don‚Äôt even know why.

item.title: Inside the Mind of Ransomware - My Experience and Insights
item.description: This ain‚Äôt just a write-up; it‚Äôs my journey‚Äîan exploration into the ruthless world of ransomware, the lessons I learned, the shocking truths I uncovered, and the very reason Snakes Ransomware became my project. From real-world cyber disasters to my own hands-on analysis, this is a story I won‚Äôt forget

item.title: The Struggle She Never Knew
item.description: She left without a word, but the pain never left me. While she moved on, I was stuck in the past, drowning in memories she never even knew I held on to.

item.title: The Call I Waited For
item.description: After all these years, after all the waiting, I finally called her. What happened next was unexpected‚Äîshe answered. A conversation filled with old memories, hidden emotions, and truths I didn‚Äôt know I needed to hear. But was it everything I had hoped for? Or just another moment that left me questioning everything?

item.title: A Red Band, A Green Dress, and A Thousand What-Ifs - Texus-2k23
item.description: I made a stupid mistake‚ÄîI deactivated my Snapchat and Instagram, and just like that, I missed everything. The event was over, but regret hit hard. I searched like crazy, slowed down a 43-minute video to 0.25x, trying to find even a glimpse of her. A red band, a green dress, a blurry frame‚Äîwas it her? I‚Äôll never know for sure. But one thing‚Äôs certain:- she was there, living the moment, while I was stuck chasing a memory I never even had.

item.title: The End is Near - The Weeknd
item.description: We Miss You Abel ,Protect this man at all costs! ü§ç "#TheWeeknd"¬† "#The End Is Near".

item.title: Until I Bleed Out ‚Äì She is Just a Nightmare Now
item.description: Harshi left, but my dreams didn‚Äôt get the memo. Now I‚Äôm just a sad boy listening to The Weeknd, trying to uninstall her from my brain like a failed Windows update.

item.title: Umesh Scolded Me! And Now I Feel Even Worse
item.description: Umesh scolded me for taking the TOEFL exam in Tirupati under Dhamodar Reddy‚Äôs guidance. It was a disaster, but Dhamodar says I can retake it in a week. Still, I don‚Äôt want to decide without her response‚Äîyet she hasn‚Äôt even seen my message. Now, I‚Äôm just stuck and feeling worse.
